definition: ten thousand crags and torrents (idiom); the trials and tribulations of a long journey/a long and difficult road
surname Wan
ten thousand/a great number
see 万俟[Mo4 qi2]
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
see 鞦韆|秋千[qiu1 qian1]
thousand
surname Shan
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

sentences.english: We write to each other often, even though we are a great distance apart.
sentences.chinese: 即使是相隔万水千山，我们也频繁书信往来。

sentences.english: We have all come a long way, "ten thousand crags and torrents" (a long and difficult road) to get here.
sentences.chinese: 我们都来自五湖四海，经历万水千山，来到了这里。

sentences.english: Then I could fly across mountains and rivers to rest on a bough before your window.
sentences.chinese: 可以飞越万水千山，停在你窗前的树梢。

sentences.english: Even numerous mountains and rivers cannot separate our friendship.
sentences.chinese: 纵然是万水千山也隔不断我们的情谊。

sentences.english: "Is not afraid of red army expedition difficult, the long march only afford".
sentences.chinese: “红军不怕远征难，万水千山只等闲”。

sentences.english: Once you have drunk the water of Nile, you will always come back.
sentences.chinese: 一朝浅饮尼罗水，万水千山总恋她。

sentences.english: Only afford is not afraid of red army expedition difficult, the long march.
sentences.chinese: 榥“红军不怕远征难，万水千山只等闲。”

sentences.english: Fly over mountains and rivers before I stop at a twig in front of your window.
sentences.chinese: 可以飞越万水千山，停在你窗前的树梢。

sentences.english: The reds fear expedition difficult, vast wounds only.
sentences.chinese: 红军不怕远征难，万水千山只等闲。

definition: see 天涯海角[tian1 ya2 hai3 jiao3]
long and arduous journey (idiom)
to travel over land and water (idiom)
high as the mountain and long as the river (idiom); fig. noble and far-reaching
so close, yet worlds apart (idiom)
Cape Haijiao in Sanya 三亞|三亚[San1 ya4], Hainan
the ends of the earth/separated worlds apart
Wanli township in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
far away/thousands of miles/10000 li
Wan Li (1916-2015), PRC politician
to pass over mountains ridges (idiom); fig. hardships of the journey
from dawn to dusk/all the time
a thousand miles/a thousand li (i.e. 500 kilometers)/a long distance
the other end of the world/a faraway place
to have experienced a lot of/to have been through
lit. the blue sea turned into mulberry fields (idiom)/fig. the transformations of the world
to trudge/to trek
to take leave of/to leave/separation
the four seasons/spring, summer, autumn and winter
